title: What Are You Waiting For? (Rebroadcast)
description: Standing in line represents a particularly sloppy — and frustrating — way for supply and demand to meet. Why haven't we found a better way to get what we want? Is it possible that we secretly enjoy waiting in line? And might it even be (gulp) good for us?
author: editor@freakonomics.com (Freakonomics Radio + Stitcher)
